snippet: Eighth graders made modest gains in national science testing, with Hispanics and blacks narrowing the gap between their white and Asian peers, the government reported Thursday.
abstract: Department of Education releases report finding that American eighth graders have made modest gains in national science testing, with Hispanic and black students narrowing the gap between them and their white and Asian peers.
lead_paragraph: Eighth graders made modest gains in national science testing, with Hispanics and blacks narrowing the gap between their white and Asian peers, the government reported Thursday.

headline.seo: 8th Grade Students Make Gains in Testing on Science
headline.main: Students Make Gains in Testing on Science
headline.print_headline: Students Make Gains In Testing On Science
